visualization_prompt: Generate an area chart showing proportional contributions with null-value gaps using percentage stacking
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two categorical series with six observations each, featuring intentional null values. Synthetic data uses uniform values (1) with strategic null placement to demonstrate visualization behavior. Both series represent equal-weight categories with artificial gaps, creating a controlled test of the stacking and connection logic. The area chart format was selected to emphasize cumulative relationships while maintaining individual series visibility through opacity stacking. Percentage stacking converts absolute values to relative proportions, satisfying Tufte's data-ink ratio by eliminating redundant absolute value markers. Cairo's principles of perceptual transparency are addressed through automatic color differentiation and area layer ordering. The connectNulls=false setting creates intentional visual breaks, preserving data integrity by avoiding misleading interpolation of missing values.
